content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given that this is a repeated game with 75 rounds, I would opt for strategy that ensures a consistent payoff over time, rather than aiming for a short-term gain. In this case, if I choose B, my opponent might choose R in response to maximize their own gain, but after several rounds, they will find it more beneficial to switch strategies and start choosing B as well (since we both get 12$ per round).

If I assume that the anonymous player is rational and wants to maximize their long-term earnings like myself, they would eventually catch on to this pattern. As a result, after some time, it's likely that we will both be choosing B more often, which would lead to earning 12$ per round for both of us. This strategy results in a total payout of $900 ($12*75) over the course of the 75 rounds, whereas consistently choosing R would only net $675 ($45*15 + 0*60). Therefore, I will choose B as my strategy for this game. {B}

Given that my opponent and I both chose B in the previous round, it seems that our strategy of choosing B consistently worked as expected. However, it's important to note that our opponent may not always choose this way, as they could potentially switch strategies in the future to maximize their earnings.

For the next round, since we are following a consistent strategy of choosing B, I will continue doing so. {B}
